3,4 Juta Warga Sumut Belum Tercover BPJS Kesehatan
05 Nov 2019, 20:50 by Indra Widyastuti


3,4 Juta Warga Sumut Belum Tercover BPJS Kesehatan

KBRN, Medan : Dari 14,9 juta warga Sumatera Utara (Sumut), baru 11,4 juta (76,58%) jiwa yang terdaftar sebagai peserta Jaminan Kesehatan Nasional (JKN) yang dikelola Badan Penyelenggara Jaminan Sosial (BPJS) Kesehatan. Masih ada 3,4 juta (23,42%) lagi warga Sumut yang belum terdaftar sebagai peserta."Cakupannya sekarang sampai September itu 76,58 persen," kata Deputi Direksi Wilayah Sumut Aceh BPJS Kesehatan, Maryamah, Selasa (5/11/2019).Maryamah menyebutkan, dari jumlah tersebut, sebagian besar atau 42 persen kepesertaan merupakan segmem penerima bantuan iuran (PBI) APBN, dan 14 persen PBI APBD."Jadi kalau kita melihat sebetulnya di sini pemerintah sudah sangat full membantu. Jadi kalau kita tambahkan sudah 56 persen ditambah lagi PPUPNS itu 8 persen, itu juga dibiayai oleh pemerintah," ujarnya.Maryamah mengungkapkan, masih banyaknya warga yang belum tercover program JKN berasal dari peserta mandiri. Hal itu menurut Maryamah disebabkan dua hal, salah satunya karena faktor kemampuan membayar (ability to pay). "Jadi memang banyak juga masyarakat yang mungkin untuk makan tiga kali sehari mampu tapi untuk membayar jaminan kesehatan kurang. Kita sudah sampaikan bahwa kalau memang arahnya kepada ketidakmampuan, silahkan lapor ke keluarahan, kecamatan untuk diteruskan ke dinsos. Selanjutnya kalau tidak mampu dapat dilanjutkan ke Kemensos untuk dimasukkan dalam PBI," kata Maryamah.Sementara bagi warga yang mampu, Maryamah mengimbau agar mendaftarkan diri sebagai peserta JKN sebelum sakit."Jangan nanti ada yang mampu, sudah sakit baru masuk. Terus komplain karena ada jangka waktu 14 hari baru aktif. Padahal dari awal dia nggak mau daftar," jelasnya.Menurut Maryamah, untuk meningkatkan kepesertaan mandiri, pihaknya juga terus melakukan sosialisasi kepada masyarakat baik secara langsung maupun tidak langsung dan juga melalui kader JKN yang ada di setiap kecamatan.

3.4 Million North Sumatra Residents Not Covered by Health BPJS
05 Nov 2019, 20:50 by Indra Widyastuti


3.4 Million North Sumatra Residents Not Covered by Health BPJS

KBRN, Medan: Of the 14.9 million people of North Sumatra (North Sumatra), only 11.4 million (76.58%) people are registered as National Health Insurance (JKN) participants managed by the Health Social Security Administering Agency (BPJS). There are still 3.4 million (23.42%) more North Sumatra residents who have not been registered as participants. "The current coverage until September is 76.58 percent," said Deputy Director of the North Sumatra Regional Health BPJS, Maryamah, Tuesday (5/11 / 2019). Maryamah said, of that amount, the majority or 42 percent of the participants were members of the state budget contribution assistance (PBI), and 14 percent of the regional budget PBI. "So if we look at it here, the government is already very full of help. So if we add 56 percent has been added by the PPUPNS, which is 8 percent, it is also funded by the government, "he said. According to Maryamah, this was caused by two things, one of which was due to the ability to pay (ability to pay). "So there are indeed many people who may be able to eat three times a day but can afford to pay for insufficient health insurance. We have said that if indeed the direction is incapacitated, please report to the household, sub-district to be forwarded to the Social Affairs. to be included in PBI, "said Maryamah. While for the able citizens, Maryamah appealed to register as a JKN participant before being sick." Do not later anyone who is able, has just been sick and entered. Continue to complain because there is a period of 14 days before being active. from the beginning he did not want to register, "he explained. According to Maryamah, to increase independent participation, his party also continued to disseminate to the community both directly and indirectly and also through JKN cadres in each district.
